ONE CLICK COURSE CREATOR

To learn more about Bliss House tools visit [www.oneclickcoursecreator.com](http://www.oneclickcoursecreator.com).

Course Title: DEFI Study

Course Description: The DEFI Study course will teach learners about decentralized finance (DEFI) and its underlying technology. Learners will gain an understanding of how DEFI differs from traditional finance, the advantages and risks associated with DEFI, and how to create and trade digital assets using smart contracts. This project-based course will provide learners with hands-on experience in developing a DEFI project.

Course Outcome: Upon completion of the course, learners will be able to design, develop, and deploy a DEFI application on the Ethereum blockchain.

Module 1: Introduction to DEFI

Lesson Plan:

* Learning Objectives: Define DEFI and compare it to traditional finance, identify the benefits and risks of DEFI, and describe the underlying technology.
* Real-World Examples: Uniswap, Compound, and Aave.
* Activities: Research and discuss the differences between traditional finance and DEFI, evaluate the benefits and risks of DEFI, and describe how smart contracts work in the context of DEFI.
* Discussion Questions: What is the difference between traditional finance and DEFI? What are the benefits and risks associated with DEFI?

Engaging Video Script:
"Welcome to Module 1 of the DEFI Study course. In this module, we'll explore the world of decentralized finance, also known as DEFI. We'll compare DEFI to traditional finance and examine the benefits and risks associated with it. We'll also take a closer look at the underlying technology that makes DEFI possible. By the end of this module, you'll have a solid understanding of DEFI and be ready to dive deeper into the world of decentralized finance."

Module 2: Smart Contracts and Solidity

Lesson Plan:

* Learning Objectives: Define smart contracts and Solidity, describe the benefits of using smart contracts, and write a basic smart contract using Solidity.
* Real-World Examples: CryptoKitties, MakerDAO, and Golem.
* Activities: Research and discuss smart contracts and Solidity, analyze the benefits of using smart contracts in DEFI applications, and write a basic smart contract using Solidity.
* Discussion Questions: What are smart contracts? What are the benefits of using smart contracts in DEFI applications?

Engaging Video Script:
"Welcome to Module 2 of the DEFI Study course. In this module, we'll take a closer look at smart contracts and Solidity. We'll explore some real-world examples of smart contracts, including CryptoKitties, MakerDAO, and Golem. We'll also discuss the benefits of using smart contracts in DEFI applications and learn how to write a basic smart contract using Solidity. By the end of this module, you'll have a good understanding of smart contracts and be ready to start writing your own."

Module 3: Decentralized Applications (DApps)

Lesson Plan:

* Learning Objectives: Define decentralized applications (DApps), describe the components of a DApp, and create a simple DApp using Truffle and React.
* Real-World Examples: Augur, Gnosis, and MyEtherWallet.
* Activities: Research and discuss DApps, analyze the components of a DApp, and create a simple DApp using Truffle and React.
* Discussion Questions: What are DApps? What are the benefits of using DApps in DEFI applications?

Engaging Video Script:
"Welcome to Module 3 of the DEFI Study course. In this module, we'll explore decentralized applications, or DApps. We'll examine some real-world examples of DApps, including Augur, Gnosis, and MyEtherWallet. We'll also learn about the components of a

DApp and how to create a simple DApp using Truffle and React. By the end of this module, you'll have a solid understanding of DApps and be ready to start building your own."

Module 4: DEFI Architecture

Lesson Plan:

* Learning Objectives: Define DEFI architecture, describe the different layers of DEFI, and analyze the risks and vulnerabilities of DEFI applications.
* Real-World Examples: Compound, MakerDAO, and dYdX.
* Activities: Research and discuss DEFI architecture, analyze the different layers of DEFI, and evaluate the risks and vulnerabilities of DEFI applications.
* Discussion Questions: What is DEFI architecture? What are the different layers of DEFI? What are the risks and vulnerabilities of DEFI applications?

Engaging Video Script:
"Welcome to Module 4 of the DEFI Study course. In this module, we'll take a closer look at DEFI architecture. We'll examine some real-world examples of DEFI applications, including Compound, MakerDAO, and dYdX. We'll also explore the different layers of DEFI and evaluate the risks and vulnerabilities of DEFI applications. By the end of this module, you'll have a good understanding of DEFI architecture and be ready to start designing your own DEFI project."

Module 5: DEFI Project Design

Lesson Plan:

* Learning Objectives: Define DEFI project design, develop a DEFI project proposal, and create a project roadmap.
* Real-World Examples: Uniswap, Compound, and Balancer.
* Activities: Research and discuss DEFI project design, develop a DEFI project proposal, and create a project roadmap.
* Discussion Questions: What is DEFI project design? What are the key components of a DEFI project proposal? How do you create a project roadmap?

Engaging Video Script:
"Welcome to Module 5 of the DEFI Study course. In this module, we'll explore DEFI project design. We'll examine some real-world examples of DEFI projects, including Uniswap, Compound, and Balancer. We'll also learn how to develop a DEFI project proposal and create a project roadmap. By the end of this module, you'll have the skills you need to start designing your own DEFI project."

Module 6: DEFI Project Development

Lesson Plan:

* Learning Objectives: Develop a DEFI project using the skills and tools learned in the previous modules.
* Real-World Examples: Your own project.
* Activities: Develop a DEFI project using the skills and tools learned in the previous modules.
* Discussion Questions: What challenges did you face while developing your DEFI project? What did you learn during the development process?

Engaging Video Script:
"Welcome to Module 6, the final module of the DEFI Study course. In this module, you'll apply the skills and tools you've learned in the previous modules to develop your own DEFI project. You'll face challenges, but you'll be able to overcome them using the skills and knowledge you've gained. By the end of this module, you'll have a fully functional DEFI project that you can be proud of."

Project Plan:

Learners will be required to develop a DEFI project using the skills and tools learned in the course. The project should include the following components:

* A DEFI application that utilizes smart contracts and the Ethereum blockchain
* A project proposal that outlines the project's purpose, functionality, and potential risks and vulnerabilities
* A project roadmap that details the development process, including milestones and timelines
* A presentation that demonstrates the project's functionality and the learner's understanding of DEFI

Expansion:

To expand learning, learners can:

* Analyze and compare different DEFI applications and projects

* Research the latest trends and developments in DEFI and cryptocurrency
* Collaborate with other learners to develop and improve their DEFI projects
* Participate in online forums and discussion groups to share knowledge and insights about DEFI
* Attend industry conferences and events to network with other DEFI enthusiasts and stay up-to-date on the latest developments in the field
